attributes.action: Shut down the Army ‘show room’, Kingsland Shopping Centre, Hackney, London
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In March '09, the Army’s first ever 'show room' opened, between high street shops, in one of London’s poorest / worst boroughs for gun crime. The ‘show room’ exploits Hackney’s high unemployment rates; offering unbalanced, glitzy views of Army life as an escape from poverty. 

In reality, in Iraq alone, nearly 200 British soldiers (+ 100,000s of civilians) have been killed; many more returning home physically and mentally maimed.

The ‘show room’ however, presents the excitement of the Army’s exploits abroad without depicting the traumas of war.

Boasting a ‘virtual battlefield simulator’, it encourages visitors (over 14 years old) to shoot their friends with replica AF80 hand guns, and test drive virtual tanks. The campaign group, Mothers Against Guns, describes this as “grossly insensitive in a borough plagued by gun violence”.

This obscene sanitisation and glorification of war is a waste of tax-payers money; diverted from health, education, and building sustainable communities.
 
Help shut down this ‘show room’ and stop the Army from opening more around the country.
